definition: to excuse sb/to exempt/to remove or dismiss from office/to avoid/to avert/to escape/to be prohibited
cannot avoid being killed/cannot escape death/to be mortal

sentences.english: Song of XuSong taste carefully, not as one of the move.
sentences.chinese: 仔细品味许嵩的歌，不免为之一动。

sentences.english: It seems churlish to refuse such a generous offer.
sentences.chinese: 拒绝这样大方的倡议不免有些失仪。

sentences.english: Carrie observed his ease with some misgiving.
sentences.chinese: 看到他这样悠闲自得，嘉莉不免有些疑惑。

sentences.english: Self-made men are most always apt to be a little too proud of the job.
sentences.chinese: 白手兴家的人，少不免总有自豪其成就的倾向。

sentences.english: This can only be due to the occasional touch, cite a few side can not but be regrettable omissions.
sentences.chinese: 本文只能因偶尔触及，略举数端，不免要挂一漏万的。

sentences.english: Alexandra was to hear more of Ivar's case .
sentences.chinese: 亚历山德拉仍不免会听到更多有关埃法尔的话题。

sentences.english: That means beyond making you feel good they have NO lasting …
sentences.chinese: 便是说它们除让你感到高兴一点里不免何的先断代价。

sentences.english: In a sense such a statement is misleading.
sentences.chinese: 从某种意义上说，这种说法不免失之偏颇。

sentences.english: The advertisement sounds too boastful to be convincing.
sentences.chinese: 这广告吹得太玄，使人不免半信半疑。

sentences.english: The lion's roar will strike terror to the bravest heart.
sentences.chinese: 即使是最勇敢的人，听到狮吼，也不免惊恐。

sentences.english: But since it is here we pretty well take it for granted.
sentences.chinese: 但既然生活在这个时代，我们不免会想当然。

sentences.english: Following the success of Sasha and Shawna, both women were inspired to pursue their solo careers.
sentences.chinese: 继萨沙和肖纳成功，两个女人也不免追求其个人事业。

sentences.english: Because of our young and ignorant, will inevitably lead to some misunderstanding or a joke.
sentences.chinese: 由于我们的年幼和无知，不免会引起一些误会或笑话。

sentences.english: It might all sound pretty strange at first.
sentences.chinese: 乍听之下，这一切不免有些奇怪。

sentences.english: The Rat saw what was passing in his mind, and wavered.
sentences.chinese: 老鼠看透了他的心里，不免犹豫起来。

definition: hard to avoid/difficult to escape from/will inevitably
